conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height/thickness, multiple faces are visible, angled/isometric-like camera, and ceiling/roof is removed to expose interior volume.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion with readable wall thickness and corners; good elevated angled view; clean cutaway overall with minor simplification of some edges/openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall zoning matches (central living/dining, kitchen at right, bedrooms at left/center/right), but several plan-specific features appear simplified/shifted (balconies/utility/passage widths and some partition locations), reducing strict layout fidelity.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (beds, sofa, dining table) and kitchen/bath fixtures included; placement largely aligns to intended room types though some rooms are sparsely/ambiguously furnished relative to the 2D labels.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with consistent materials and good visibility; however, large text labels inside the 3D view reduce presentation cleanliness, and some openings/door details are not clearly resolved.

detected_errors.description: Several plan elements appear geometrically simplified or shifted (e.g., balcony/utility/passage and some internal partition placements), reducing strict 2D-to-3D layout fidelity.
Door/window locations and/or sizes are not fully consistent/complete compared to the 2D plan; some openings are missing or not clearly placed.
Text labels (e.g., BEDROOM-1/2, TOILET, KITCHEN) appear in the 3D render, impacting presentation score.

summary: A genuine 3D cutaway conversion with strong volumetric modeling, but only moderate strict fidelity to the exact 2D plan geometry and openings.
